message.content:
{"id": "3666", "title": "Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)", "description": "Bug 3666: Code Completion

Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5) 

Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature consumes too much code. Consider the enclosed class.

As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the 'baz' call in 'bar' to make the program correct.

Steps:
1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of the current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, in order to control the amount of source to replace.

The code is changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

I would rather it gave me:

baz(x.foo()x.foo())

public class X {
    void bar(X x) {
        baz(x.foo());
    }
    int foo() {
        return 5;
    }
    void baz(int i, int j) {
    }
}

KUM (5/21/01 9:02:11 AM)
The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.

Moved to ITPJCORE.

PM (9/4/2001 2:58:56 PM)
Option was added.

PM (9/25/2001 2:20:50 PM)
Removing option.

The choice amongst one or the other should be conditioned by a keystroke (enter=replace until end, insert=replace until cursor location).

Moving to ITPJUI.", "OB": "The code in the 'baz' call in 'bar' is changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

I would rather it gave me:

baz(x.foo()x.foo())", "EB": "The code in the 'baz' call in 'bar' is changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

I would rather it gave me:

baz(x.foo()x.foo())

The choice amongst one or the other should be conditioned by a keystroke (enter=replace until end, insert=replace until cursor location).

Moving to ITPJUI.", "SR": "The code assist feature should allow for the choice between replacing until the end of the current identifier or until the cursor location. This choice should be conditioned by a keystroke (enter=replace until end, insert=replace until cursor location). Furthermore, the bug report should be moved to ITPJUI."}
